H0.text: Absorption is a way that protists can obtain food besides ingesting and photosynthesis.

H1.text: Digestion is how protists can obtain food besides ingesting and photosynthesis.

H2.text: Accumulation is a way protists can obtain food besides ingesting and photosynthesis.

H3.text: Osmosis is a method by which protists obtain their food besides ingesting and photosynthesis.

A4.text: Osmotrophic protists acquire soluble nutrients through membrane channels and carriers, but also through pinocytosis: the nutrients are trapped in vesicles that merge into a digestive vacuole or endosome where digestion takes place.

A5.text: Saprotrophs release enzymes for external digestion, making it available to plants and other microbes.
